description.en: This class represents the legislation, policy or policies that lie behind the Rules that govern the service.

usage.en: The definition and properties of the Legal Resource class are aligned with the ontology included in "Council conclusions inviting the introduction of the European Legislation Identifier (ELI)". For describing the attributes of a Legal Resource (labels, preferred labels, alternative labels, definition, etc.) we refer to the ELI ontology. In this data specification the use is restricted to instances of this class that follow the ELI URI guidelines.

rawTags.definition-en: This class represents the legislation, policy or policies that lie behind the Rules that govern the service.
rawTags.ap-usageNote-en: The definition and properties of the Legal Resource class are aligned with the ontology included in "Council conclusions inviting the introduction of the European Legislation Identifier (ELI)". For describing the attributes of a Legal Resource (labels, preferred labels, alternative labels, definition, etc.) we refer to the ELI ontology. In this data specification the use is restricted to instances of this class that follow the ELI URI guidelines.

description.en: A legal document giving official permission to do something with a resource.

usage.en: The HVD regulation requires a machine readable representation of a Licence. The minimal data model to describe a licence Document is beyond this specification. Nevertheless in [[[#c3]]] some suggestions are made.

rawTags.ap-definition-en: A legal document giving official permission to do something with a resource.
rawTags.ap-usageNote-en: The HVD regulation requires a machine readable representation of a Licence. The minimal data model to describe a licence Document is beyond this specification. Nevertheless in [[[#c3]]] some suggestions are made.

description.en: A statement about the intellectual property rights (IPR) held in or over a resource, a legal document giving official permission to do something with a resource, or a statement about access rights.

rawTags.ap-definition-en: A statement about the intellectual property rights (IPR) held in or over a resource, a legal document giving official permission to do something with a resource, or a statement about access rights.

description.en: A standard or other specification to which a Dataset or Distribution conforms.

rawTags.ap-definition-en: A standard or other specification to which a Dataset or Distribution conforms.

description.en: A literal value such as a string or integer; Literals may be typed, e.g. as a date according to xsd:date. Literals that contain human-readable text have an optional language tag as defined by BCP 4715 [[rfc5646]].

rawTags.ap-definition-en: A literal value such as a string or integer; Literals may be typed, e.g. as a date according to xsd:date. Literals that contain human-readable text have an optional language tag as defined by BCP 4715 [[rfc5646]].

description.en: Anything described by RDF.

rawTags.ap-definition-en: Anything described by RDF.

description.en: An idea or notion; a unit of thought.

usage.en: In DCAT-AP, a Concept is used to denote codes within a codelist. In section [[[#controlled-vocs]]] the expectations are elaborated in more detail.

rawTags.definition-en: An idea or notion; a unit of thought.
rawTags.ap-usageNote-en: In DCAT-AP, a Concept is used to denote codes within a codelist. In section [[[#controlled-vocs]]] the expectations are elaborated in more detail.

description.en: A description following the vCard specification, e.g. to provide telephone number and e-mail address for a contact point.

usage.en: Article3.4 requires to designate a point of contact for an API. It is recommended to provide  at least either an email or a contact form from e.g. a service desk.

rawTags.ap-definition-en: A description following the vCard specification, e.g. to provide telephone number and e-mail address for a contact point.
rawTags.ap-usageNote-en: Article3.4 requires to designate a point of contact for an API. It is recommended to provide  at least either an email or a contact form from e.g. a service desk.

description.en: A email address via which contact can be made.

rawTags.ap-definition-en: A email address via which contact can be made.

description.en: A webpage that either allows to make contact (i.e. a webform) or the information contains how to get into contact.

rawTags.ap-definition-en: A webpage that either allows to make contact (i.e. a webform) or the information contains how to get into contact.

description.en: A catalogue or repository that hosts the Datasets or Data Services being described.

rawTags.ap-definition-en: A catalogue or repository that hosts the Datasets or Data Services being described.

description.en: A Dataset that is part of the Catalogue.

usage.en: As empty Catalogues are usually indications of problems, this property should be combined with the next property service to implement an empty Catalogue check.

rawTags.ap-definition-en: A Dataset that is part of the Catalogue.
rawTags.ap-usageNote-en: As empty Catalogues are usually indications of problems, this property should be combined with the next property service to implement an empty Catalogue check.

description.en: A Catalogue Record that is part of the Catalogue

rawTags.ap-definition-en: A Catalogue Record that is part of the Catalogue

description.en: A site or end-point (Data Service) that is listed in the Catalogue.

usage.en: As empty Catalogues are usually indications of problems, this property should be combined with the previous property dataset to implement an empty Catalogue check.

rawTags.ap-definition-en: A site or end-point (Data Service) that is listed in the Catalogue.
rawTags.ap-usageNote-en: As empty Catalogues are usually indications of problems, this property should be combined with the previous property dataset to implement an empty Catalogue check.

description.en: A description of a Dataset's entry in the Catalogue.

rawTags.ap-definition-en: A description of a Dataset's entry in the Catalogue.

description.en: A link to the Dataset, Data service or Catalog described in the record.

usage.en: A catalogue record will refer to one entity in a catalogue. This can be either a Dataset or a Data Service. To ensure an unambigous reading of the cardinality the range is set to Catalogued Resource. However it is not the intend with this range to require the explicit use of the class Catalogued Record. As abstract class, an subclass should be used.

rawTags.ap-definition-en: A link to the Dataset, Data service or Catalog described in the record.
rawTags.ap-usageNote-en: A catalogue record will refer to one entity in a catalogue. This can be either a Dataset or a Data Service. To ensure an unambigous reading of the cardinality the range is set to Catalogued Resource. However it is not the intend with this range to require the explicit use of the class Catalogued Record. As abstract class, an subclass should be used.

description.en: A collection of operations that provides access to one or more datasets or data processing functions.

rawTags.ap-definition-en: A collection of operations that provides access to one or more datasets or data processing functions.

description.en: The legislation that mandates the creation or management of the Data Service.

usage.en:
For HVD the value MUST include the ELI http://data.europa.eu/eli/reg_impl/2023/138/oj.
As multiple legislations may apply to the resource the maximum cardinality is not limited.

rawTags.name: applicableLegislation
rawTags.ap-definition-en: The legislation that mandates the creation or management of the Data Service.
rawTags.ap-usageNote-en:
For HVD the value MUST include the ELI http://data.europa.eu/eli/reg_impl/2023/138/oj.

description.en: The HVD category to which this Data Service belongs.

rawTags.ap-definition-en: The HVD category to which this Data Service belongs.

description.en: A licence under which the Data service is made available.

usage.en: Article 3.3 specifies that the terms of use should be provided. According to the guidelines for legal Information in DCAT-AP HVD this is fullfilled by providing by preference a licence. As alternative rights can be used.

rawTags.ap-definition-en: A licence under which the Data service is made available.
rawTags.ap-usageNote-en: Article 3.3 specifies that the terms of use should be provided. According to the guidelines for legal Information in DCAT-AP HVD this is fullfilled by providing by preference a licence. As alternative rights can be used.

description.en: A statement that specifies rights associated with the Distribution.

usage.en: Article 3.3 specifies that the terms of use should be provided. According to the guidelines for legal Information in DCAT-AP HVD this is fullfilled by providing by preference a licence. As alternative rights can be used.

rawTags.ap-definition-en: A statement that specifies rights associated with the Distribution.
rawTags.ap-usageNote-en: Article 3.3 specifies that the terms of use should be provided. According to the guidelines for legal Information in DCAT-AP HVD this is fullfilled by providing by preference a licence. As alternative rights can be used.

description.en: Contact information that can be used for sending comments about the Data Service.

usage.en: Article 3.4 requires the designation of a point of contact for an API.

rawTags.ap-definition-en: Contact information that can be used for sending comments about the Data Service.
rawTags.ap-usageNote-en: Article 3.4 requires the designation of a point of contact for an API.

description.en: A description of the services available via the end-points, including their operations, parameters etc.

usage.en:
The property gives specific details of the actual endpoint instances, while dct:conformsTo is used to indicate the general standard or specification that the endpoints implement.
Article 3.3 requires to provide API documentation in a Union or internationally recognised open, human-readable and machine-readable format.

rawTags.ap-definition-en: A description of the services available via the end-points, including their operations, parameters etc.
rawTags.ap-usageNote-en:
The property gives specific details of the actual endpoint instances, while dct:conformsTo is used to indicate the general standard or specification that the endpoints implement.
Article 3.3 requires to provide API documentation in a Union or internationally recognised open, human-readable and machine-readable format.

description.en: The root location or primary endpoint of the service (an IRI).

usage.en: The endpoint URL SHOULD be persistent. This means that publishers should do everything in their power to maintain the value stable and existing.

rawTags.ap-definition-en: The root location or primary endpoint of the service (an IRI).
rawTags.ap-usageNote-en: The endpoint URL SHOULD be persistent. This means that publishers should do everything in their power to maintain the value stable and existing.

description.en: This property refers to a collection of data that this data service can distribute.

usage.en: An API in the context of HVD is not a standalone resource. It is used to open up HVD datasets. Therefore each Data Service is at least tightly connected with a Dataset.

rawTags.ap-definition-en: This property refers to a collection of data that this data service can distribute.
rawTags.ap-usageNote-en: An API in the context of HVD is not a standalone resource. It is used to open up HVD datasets. Therefore each Data Service is at least tightly connected with a Dataset.

description.en: A page that provides additional information about the Data Service.

usage.en: Quality of service covers a broad spectrum of aspects. The HVD regulation does not list any mandatory topic. Therefore quality of service information is considered part of the generic documentation of a Data Service.

rawTags.ap-usageNote-en: Quality of service covers a broad spectrum of aspects. The HVD regulation does not list any mandatory topic. Therefore quality of service information is considered part of the generic documentation of a Data Service.
rawTags.ap-definition-en: A page that provides additional information about the Data Service.

description.en: A conceptual entity that represents the information published.

rawTags.ap-definition-en: A conceptual entity that represents the information published.

description.en: The legislation that mandates the creation or management of the Dataset.

usage.en:
For HVD the value must include the ELI http://data.europa.eu/eli/reg_impl/2023/138/oj.
As multiple legislations may apply to the resource the maximum cardinality is not limited.

description.en: The HVD category to which this Dataset belongs.

description.en: An implementing rule or other specification.

usage.en: The provided information should enable to the verification whether the detailed information requirements by the HVD is satisfied. For more usage suggestions see section on specific data requirements.

rawTags.ap-usageNote-en: The provided information should enable to the verification whether the detailed information requirements by the HVD is satisfied. For more usage suggestions see section on specific data requirements.

description.en: Contact information that can be used for sending comments about the Dataset.

rawTags.ap-definition-en: Contact information that can be used for sending comments about the Dataset.

description.en: An available Distribution for the Dataset.

usage.en: The HVD IR is a quality improvement of existing datasets. The intention is that HVD datasets are publicly and open accessible. Therefore a Distribution is expected to be present. (Article 3.1)

rawTags.ap-definition-en: An available Distribution for the Dataset.
rawTags.ap-usageNote-en: The HVD IR is a quality improvement of existing datasets. The intention is that HVD datasets are publicly and open accessible. Therefore a Distribution is expected to be present. (Article 3.1)

description.en: A dataset series of which the dataset is part.

rawTags.definition-en: A dataset series of which the dataset is part.

description.en: A collection of datasets that are published separately,but share some characteristics that group them.

usage.en: It is recommended to avoid Dataset Series without a dataset in the collection. Therefore at least one Dataset should refer to a Dataset Series using the property in series (dcat:inSeries).

rawTags.ap-usageNote-en: It is recommended to avoid Dataset Series without a dataset in the collection. Therefore at least one Dataset should refer to a Dataset Series using the property in series (dcat:inSeries).

usage.en:
For HVD the value must include the ELI http://data.europa.eu/eli/reg_impl/2023/138/oj.
As multiple legislations may apply to the resource the maximum cardinality is not limited.

description.en: The HVD category to which this Dataset belongs.

description.en: A physical embodiment of the Dataset in a particular format.

usage.en: Bulk downloads should be encoded as a Distribution.

description.en: An established schema to which the described Distribution conforms.

usage.en: The provided information should enable to the verification whether the detailed information requirements by the HVD is satisfied. For more usage suggestions see section on specific data requirements.

description.en: A licence under which the Distribution is made available.

usage.en: Article 4.3 specifies that High-value datasets should be made available for reuse. According to the guidelines for legal Information in DCAT-AP HVD this is fullfilled by providing by preference a licence. As alternative rights can be used.

description.en: A data service that gives access to the distribution of the dataset

rawTags.ap-definition-en: A data service that gives access to the distribution of the dataset

description.en: A URL that gives access to a Distribution of the Dataset.

usage.en:
The resource at the access URL  contains information about how to get the Dataset.
In accordance to the DCAT guidelines it is preferred to also set the downloadURL property if the URL is a reference to a downloadable resource.

rawTags.ap-definition-en: A URL that gives access to a Distribution of the Dataset.
rawTags.ap-usageNote-en:
The resource at the access URL  contains information about how to get the Dataset.
In accordance to the DCAT guidelines it is preferred to also set the downloadURL property if the URL is a reference to a downloadable resource.

description.en: Resource published or curated by a single agent.

usage.en: For DCAT-AP, the class is considered an abstract notion.
